abstract: Asia has seen remarkable displays of hard power and soft power in recent days, as the region struggles to come to grips with frozen and seemingly intractable conflicts. There have been war games, the display of China's new aircraft carrier, Vietnamese monks being sent to "occupy" a disputed island and a South Korean-born conductor leading an orchestra with North Korean musicians. So, do six Buddhists trump one warship?
